body:
# rosegold

Minecraft client written in [Crystal](http://crystal-lang.org/), following the [botting rules](https://civwiki.org/wiki/Botting#Botting_Rules) of [CivMC](https://civwiki.org/wiki/CivMC)

## Use as a standalone client

0. [Install Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/install/)
1. [Install the Shards dependency manager](https://github.com/crystal-lang/shards#install)
2. Download the code: `git clone git@github.com:grepsedawk/rosegold.cr.git`
3. Install the dependencies: `shards install`
4. Build the executable: `crystal build src/rosegold.cr`
5. Launch the client: `./rosegold`
5. Follow the instructions to log into your Minecraft account

## Use as a library

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     rosegold:
       github: grepsedawk/rosegold.cr
   ```

2. Run `shards install`
3. Import the module:

   ```crystal
   require "rosegold"
   ```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/grepsedawk/rosegold.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [grepsedawk](https://github.com/grepsedawk) - creator and maintainer
- [Gjum](https://github.com/Gjum) - contributor

class_methods.name: prompt_for_login!
class_methods.doc:
Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-device-code
Returns the access token as a String
class_methods.summary: Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.

def.name: prompt_for_login!
def.body:
(JSON.parse((HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/devicecode", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access")).body)).try do |json|
  STDERR.puts(json["message"])
  loop do
    sleep(5)
    (JSON.parse((HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/token", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access&code=#{json["device_code"]}&grant_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code")).body)).try do |token|
      if token["error"]?
        next
      end
      STDERR.puts("Login successful!")
      return token["access_token"].as_s
    end
  end
end

def.name: hexdigest
def.body:
digest = Digest::SHA1.new
yield digest
big = BigInt.new((OpenSSL::BN.from_bin(digest.final)).to_dec)
if (big.bit(159)) == 1
  "-" + (((BigInt.new((big.to_s(2)).gsub({'0' => '1', '1' => '0'}), 2)) + 1).to_s(16))
else
  big.to_s(16)
end

def.name: read_fully
def.body:
upstream_size = @io.read_fully(slice)
upstream = slice[0, upstream_size]
o = @read_cipher.update(upstream)
slice.copy_from(o)
upstream_size

def.name: read_var_int
def.body:
result = 0_u32
shift = 0
loop do
  b = read_byte
  result = result | (((127 & b).to_u32) << shift)
  if (b & 128) == 0
    return result
  end
  shift = shift + 7
end

def.name: write

args.name: value
args.restriction: UInt16 | Int16 | UInt32 | Int32 | UInt64 | Int64

def.body:
a = Array(UInt8).new
more = true
while more
  b = (value & 127).to_u8
  value = value >> 7
  if value == 0
    more = false
  else
    b = b | 128
  end
  a << b
end
write(a.to_unsafe.to_slice(a.size))

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```
instance_methods.summary: Appends a short String representation of this object which includes its class name and its object address.

instance_methods.name: queue_packet
instance_methods.doc: Used to send a packet to the server concurrently
instance_methods.summary: Used to send a packet to the server concurrently

instance_methods.name: send_packet!
instance_methods.doc:
Used to send a packet in the current fiber, useful for things like
EncryptionRequest, because it must change the IO socket only AFTER
a EncryptionResponse has been sent
instance_methods.summary: Used to send a packet in the current fiber, useful for things like EncryptionRequest, because it must change the IO socket only AFTER a EncryptionResponse has been sent

def.name: start
def.body:
queue_packet(Serverbound::Handshake.new(PROTOCOL_VERSION, host, port.to_u16, 2.to_u8))
self.state = State::Login.new
queue_packet(Serverbound::LoginStart.new(ENV["MC_NAME"]))
spawn do
  loop do
    read_packet
  end
end
sleep

def.name: start_physics
def.body:
spawn do
  while state.is_a?(State::Play)
    queue_packet(Serverbound::PlayerPositionAndLook.new(player.feet, player.look, player.on_ground))
    sleep(0.05)
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(chunk_x, chunk_z, heightmaps, data)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)

_

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do
  "Chunk #{chunk_x},#{chunk_z} data len: #{data.size}"
end
source = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(data)
chunk = World::Chunk.new(source)
client.dimension.set_chunk(({chunk_x, chunk_z}), chunk)

def.name: callback
def.body:
encryption_response = Serverbound::EncryptionResponse.new(self)
client.send_packet!(encryption_response)
client.io = Minecraft::EncryptedTCPSocket.new(client.io, "aes-128-cfb8", encryption_response.shared_secret, encryption_response.shared_secret)

def.name: callback
def.body:
client.state = State::Play.new
Log.info do
  "Logged in as #{username} #{uuid}"
end
client.start_physics

def.name: feet
def.body: Vec3d.new(relative_flags & 1 ? reference.x + x_raw : x_raw, relative_flags & 2 ? reference.y + y_raw : y_raw, relative_flags & 4 ? reference.z + z_raw : z_raw)

def.name: look
def.body: LookDeg.new(relative_flags & 8 ? reference_deg.yaw + yaw_deg_raw : yaw_deg_raw, relative_flags & 16 ? reference_deg.pitch + pitch_deg_raw : pitch_deg_raw)

types.name: Look
types.doc:
The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0 at (0, 1), 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0).

Yaw is not clamped to between 0 and 360 degrees; any number is valid, including negative numbers and numbers greater than 360.

Pitch 0 is looking straight ahead, -90 is looking straight up, and 90 is looking straight down.

There are an infinite number of "down"/"up" looks with different yaw; use e.g. `NORTH.down`.
types.summary: The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0 at (0, 1), 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0).

def.body: self.new(x + look.x, y + look.y, z + look.z)
self.new(x - look.x, y - look.y, z - look.z)

def.body:
if long_array.is_nil?
  return palette.not_nil![0]
end
long_index = index // entries_per_long
bit_offset_in_long = (index % entries_per_long) * bits_per_entry
value = long_array[long_index] >> bit_offset_in_long
value = (value & entry_mask).to_u16
palette.try(&.[](value)) || value

if !palette
  entry = value
else
  entry = palette.index(value)
  if entry.is_nil?
    max_palette_size = 1_i64 << bits_per_entry
    if palette.size < max_palette_size
      entry = palette.size
      palette << value
    else
      raise("Growing PalettedContainer is not implemented")
    end
  end
end
long_index = index // entries_per_long
bit_offset_in_long = (index % entries_per_long) * bits_per_entry
long = long_array[long_index]
long = long & (~(entry_mask << bit_offset_in_long))
long = long | ((entry & entry_mask) << bit_offset_in_long)
long_array[long_index] = long

def.name: digest
def.body:
Minecraft::Digest.hexdigest do |digest|
  digest << encryption_request.server_id
  digest << shared_secret
  digest << encryption_request.public_key
end

def.name: send_join_request!
def.body:
if send_join_request
else
  raise("Join Request Failed")
end

def.name: to_packet
def.body:
send_join_request!
(OpenSSL::PKey::RSA.new(IO::Memory.new(("-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\n" + (Base64.encode(encryption_request.public_key))) + "-----END PUBLIC KEY-----\n"))).try do |key|
  Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
    buffer.write(PACKET_ID)
    (key.public_encrypt(shared_secret)).try do |encrypted_secret|
      buffer.write(encrypted_secret.size.to_u32)
      buffer.write(encrypted_secret)
    end
    (key.public_encrypt(encryption_request.verify_token)).try do |encrypted_nonce|
      buffer.write(encrypted_nonce.size.to_u32)
      buffer.write(encrypted_nonce)
    end
  end
end

def.name: to_packet
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(PACKET_ID)
  buffer.write(entity_id)
  buffer.write(action_id)
  buffer.write(jump_boost)
end

def.name: to_packet
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(PACKET_ID)

end

def.name: new
def.body: self.new(feet.x, feet.y, feet.z, look_deg.yaw, look_deg.pitch, on_ground)

def.name: to_packet
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(PACKET_ID)
  buffer.write(x)
  buffer.write(y)
  buffer.write(z)
  buffer.write(yaw_deg)
  buffer.write(pitch_deg)
  buffer.write(on_ground)
end

case packet_id
when 0
  Clientbound::Disconnect
when 1
  Clientbound::EncryptionRequest
when 2
  Clientbound::LoginSuccess
when 3
  Clientbound::SetCompression
when 4
  Clientbound::LoginPluginRequest
else
  raise("Unknown packet id: 0x#{Bytes[packet_id].hexstring} for State::Login")
end

case packet_id
when 26
  Clientbound::Disconnect
when 38
  Clientbound::JoinGame
when 33
  Clientbound::KeepAlive
when 48
  Clientbound::Ping
when 56
  Clientbound::PlayerPositionAndLook
when 61
  nil
when 82
  Clientbound::UpdateHealth
when 34
  Clientbound::ChunkData
when 29
  nil
when 12
  nil
when 63
  nil
when 72
  nil
when 46
  nil
when 19
  nil
when 20
  nil
when 22
  nil
when 102
  nil
when 15
  Clientbound::Chat
when 54
  nil
when 13
  nil
when 65
  nil
when 89
  nil
when 95
  nil
end

case packet_id
when 0
  Clientbound::Status
else
  raise("Unknown packet id: 0x#{Bytes[packet_id].hexstring} for State::Status")
end
self.new(x * scalar, y * scalar, z * scalar)
self.new(x * scalar, y * scalar, z * scalar)
self.new(x + vec.x, y + vec.y, z + vec.z)
self.new(x - vec.x, y - vec.y, z - vec.z)
self.new(x / scalar, y / scalar, z / scalar)

instance_methods.name: block_state
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Int32, y : Int32, z : Int32) : BlockStateNr?

def.name: block_state
def.body:
x, z = x & 15, z & 15
section = sections[(y - min_y) >> 4]? || (return nil)
index = ((((y - min_y) & 15) << 8) | (z << 4)) | x
section.block_state(index.to_u32)

instance_methods.name: set_block_state
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Int32, y : Int32, z : Int32, block_state : BlockStateNr)
instance_methods.args_html: (x : Int32, y : Int32, z : Int32, block_state : BlockStateNr)

def.name: set_block_state
def.body:
x, z = x & 15, z & 15
section = sections[(y - min_y) >> 4]
index = ((((y - min_y) & 15) << 8) | (z << 4)) | x
section.get_block_state(index.to_u32)

instance_methods.args_string: (x : Int32, y : Int32, z : Int32) : UInt16?
